qas.question: Which interstate is the only one that uses kilometer posts instead of mileposts?
Are the speed limits on I-19 marked in miles or kilometers?
What border does I-19 come close to?
Which interstate would you take to go to Jackson Florida from Tuscon Arizona?
Which direction does I-10 run through Tucson?
What is the next major town to the west on I-10?
What is the next major town to the east on I-10?
Which direction does I-19 run from Tucson?

answers.text: the only Interstate highway that uses "kilometer posts" instead of "mileposts"

context: <a3_0>Interstate 10<a3_0/>, which runs <a4_0>southeast to northwest<a4_0/> through town, connects Tucson to <a5_0>Phoenix<a5_0/> to the northwest on the way to its western terminus in Santa Monica, California, and to <a6_0>Las Cruces, New Mexico<a6_0/> and El Paso, Texas toward its eastern terminus in Jacksonville, Florida. I-19 runs <a7_0>south<a7_0/> from Tucson toward Nogales and the <a2_0>U.S.-Mexico border<a2_0/>. <a0_0>I-19<a0_0/> is <a8_0>the only Interstate highway that uses "kilometer posts" instead of "mileposts"<a8_0/>, although the speed limits are marked in <a1_0>miles<a1_0/> per hour instead of kilometers per hour.
